title: Moel Fferna
text:
Moel Fferna is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> in <a href="Denbighshire">Denbighshire</a>, <a href="Wales">Wales</a> and forms part of the <a href="Berwyn%20range">Berwyn range</a>. It is the most northern outpost of the range. The summit is covered in deep heather and has a shelter cairn. 
A trig point used to mark the summit, but has since been destroyed. To the south is <a href="Pen%20Bwlch%20Llandrillo">Pen Bwlch Llandrillo</a>, followed by <a href="Cadair%20Bronwen">Cadair Bronwen</a>. It is the highest peak in the <a href="Clwydian%20Range%20and%20Dee%20Valley">Clwydian Range and Dee Valley</a> <a href="Area%20of%20Outstanding%20Natural%20Beauty">Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty</a>.
